title: Take a Trip Down Forsaken Memories Lane During the July Trading Post

Warrior.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Mage.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Rogue.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Priest.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Paladin.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Hunter.summary:
The July Trading Post features several Forsaken-themed cosmetic items relevant to Hunters.
  • Wailing Banshee’s Longbow and Forsaken’s Grotesque Longbow are available as Bow transmogs.
  • Forsaken’s Grotesque Quiver and Wailing Banshee’s Quiver are available as Back transmogs.
  • The bonus rewards include Ensemble: Forsaken’s Grotesque Collection, which provides a full armor transmog set.
  • Players can earn Trader's Tender by completing various in-game activities, including those that can be applied to Hunter gameplay.

Warlock.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Death Knight.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Druid.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Monk.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Evoker.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Demon Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Delves.summary:
The July Trading Post features Forsaken-themed rewards, including a mount, transmog set, and back item.
  • Players can earn Trader's Tender by completing activities in the Traveler's Log, which can be used to purchase these items.
  • Bonus rewards are unlocked by accumulating points through these activities.
  • The Forsaken's Grotesque Charger mount, Ensemble: Forsaken's Grotesque Collection transmog, and Forsaken's Grotesque Cauldron back item are the new rewards.
  • Trader's Tender can be saved and accumulated across months, and items can be "frozen" for future purchase.

Raiding.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

M+.summary:
The July Trading Post features Forsaken-themed rewards and allows earning Trader's Tender through various activities, including Mythic+ dungeons.
  • Players can earn Trader's Tender by completing activities listed in the Traveler's Log, which includes running Mythic+ dungeons.
  • The July Trading Post offers Forsaken-themed transmog sets, mounts, pets, and weapon appearances.
  • Bonus rewards for July include the Forsaken’s Grotesque Cauldron, Ensemble: Forsaken’s Grotesque Collection, and Forsaken’s Grotesque Charger, earned by filling the Traveler's Log bar.
  • Trader's Tender can be accumulated and saved for future purchases, and items can be "frozen" to remain available across months.
  • The Trading Post is accessible in Dornogal on the Isle of Dorn, as well as in Stormwind and Orgrimmar.

PvP.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Open World.summary:
July's Trading Post features a Forsaken theme with new rewards.
  • New Forsaken-themed rewards include the Forsaken’s Grotesque Cauldron, Ensemble: Forsaken’s Grotesque Collection, and Forsaken’s Grotesque Charger.
  • Players can earn Trader's Tender by completing activities in the Traveler's Log to unlock these rewards.
  • The Trading Post is available in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, and Dornogal.
  • A variety of mounts, pets, transmog gear, and weapon appearances are available for purchase.

General.summary:
July's Trading Post features a Forsaken theme with new rewards and familiar vendors.
  • New Forsaken-themed rewards include the Grotesque Cauldron, Collection transmog, and Charger mount.
  • Players can purchase items from vendors in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, and Dornogal.
  • Available items include various mounts, pets, armor, and weapon transmogs.
  • Bonus rewards are unlocked by completing activities in the Traveler's Log.
  • Unspent Trader's Tender carries over to future months.

title: Stop Greedy Goblins and Get Diabolical Goodies Starting July 1

Warrior.summary:
Warrior armor sets are among the diabolical rewards available during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Recolors of classic Tier 2 armor sets are obtainable.
  • Hellstone Shards are earned from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins and event activities.
  • These shards can be exchanged for hellish armor sets and other items.

Mage.summary:
Mage armor sets are among the diabolical rewards available during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Players can earn Hellstone Shards by defeating Treasure Goblins and participating in event activities.
  • Hellstone Shards can be exchanged for hellish armor sets, including recolors of classic Tier 2 sets for Mages.
  • The event features Treasure Goblins with various affixes that can be customized using Elixirs.
  • These affixes include effects like spawning Arcane Overloads, dealing Shadowflame damage, or creating pools of lightning.

Rogue.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event returns with new rewards and mechanics.
  • Rogues can obtain recolors of classic Tier 2 armor sets from Hellcaller Chests earned during the event.
  • Hellstone Shards are the currency used to purchase these rewards from Hellhunter Baranar in Dornogal.
  • Treasure Goblins encountered during the event can have various affixes, some of which can be customized with Elixirs.
  • The Collector's Bounty buff increases drop rates for legacy mounts and transmog items in pre-Dragonflight raids and dungeons.

Priest.summary:
Priests can acquire recolors of classic Tier 2 armor sets during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Priests can obtain recolored Tier 2 armor sets.
  • These sets are exchanged for Hellstone Shards.
  • Hellstone Shards are earned from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins.
  • Hellcaller Chests can also contain Valorstones and other items.

Paladin.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event introduces new rewards and mechanics for players.
  • Paladins can obtain recolored Tier 2 armor sets through the Hellstone Shards currency earned during the event.
  • Treasure Goblins encountered during the event can have various affixes, some of which can be customized using Elixirs.
  • The Collector's Bounty buff increases drop rates for legacy mounts and specific transmog items from pre-Dragonflight raids and dungeons.
  • Portals spawn in various locations, including Dornogal, Orgrimmar, Stormwind, and the Undermine, offering opportunities to encounter Treasure Goblins.
  • Hellcaller Chests, dropped by Treasure Goblins, can contain Hellstone Shards, Valorstones, and other items.

Hunter.summary:
Hunter armor sets are among the diabolical rewards available during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Players can earn Hellstone Shards from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins.
  • These shards can be exchanged for hellish armor sets, including recolors of classic Tier 2 armor sets for Hunters.
  • The Greedy Emissary event runs from July 1 to July 29.
  • Treasure Goblins can be customized with various affixes using Elixirs, offering different challenges and rewards.

Warlock.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Death Knight.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Druid.summary:
Druids can obtain recolors of classic Tier 2 armor sets during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Druids can acquire recolored Tier 2 armor sets.
  • These sets are exchanged for Hellstone Shards earned during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Hellstone Shards are obtained from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins and event activities.
  • The event runs from July 1 to July 29.

Monk.summary:
Monks can acquire recolored Tier 2 armor sets during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Monks can obtain recolored versions of classic Tier 2 armor sets.
  • These sets are exchanged for Hellstone Shards earned from Treasure Goblins and event activities.
  • Hellstone Shards are obtained from Hellcaller Chests, which can also contain Valorstones and other items.

Evoker.summary:
Evoker armor set recolors are available as rewards during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • Players can earn Hellstone Shards by defeating Treasure Goblins and completing event activities.
  • Hellstone Shards can be exchanged for various rewards, including recolored armor sets.
  • The Evoker armor set recolors are among the diabolical rewards obtainable during the event.

Demon Hunter.summary:
Demon Hunters can acquire recolored Tier 2 armor sets during the Greedy Emissary event.
  • The event runs from July 1st to July 29th.
  • Hellstone Shards are earned from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins and event activities.
  • These shards can be exchanged for rewards, including the Demon Hunter recolored Tier 2 armor.

Delves.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event returns, featuring increased Treasure Goblin spawns and new rewards.
  • Treasure Goblins will appear more frequently in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, Dornogal, and The Undermine, offering new rewards including the Inarius' Charger mount.
  • Hellstone Shards are earned from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins and event activities, used to purchase hellish armor sets, including recolors of classic Tier 2 sets.
  • The Collector's Bounty buff doubles transmog loot drop rates and increases mount drop rates by up to 25 times in pre-Dragonflight legacy raids and dungeons.
  • Portals to Treasure Goblins spawn hourly in capital cities and can be triggered by defeating rares or specific bosses in the Liberation of Undermine raid.
  • Portal Storms in The Undermine spawn additional portals with enhanced affixes, and players can use Elixirs to customize Treasure Goblin affixes for increased challenge and rewards.

Raiding.summary:
The Collector's Bounty buff increases drop rates for legacy mounts and transmog items in pre-Dragonflight raids and dungeons.
  • Drop rates for pre-Dragonflight legacy mounts from dungeons and raids are increased up to 10 times.
  • Transmog loot drop rates in pre-Dragonflight legacy raids and dungeons are doubled.
  • Specific items like the Eye of Sulfuras, Golden Hearthstone Card, Bindings of the Windseeker, Warglaives of Azzinoth, and Thori'dal, The Stars' Fury have significantly increased drop chances.
  • The buff is active by default but can be toggled on or off at any innkeeper in capital cities and Dalaran.
  • The event runs from July 1 to July 29.

M+.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event introduces new mechanics and rewards for players.
  • Treasure Goblins will spawn with various affixes, indicated by icons, which can be customized using Elixirs.
  • Elixirs like Arcane, Blistering, and Explosive add specific challenges and effects when used on Goblin summoning portals.
  • Players can earn Hellstone Shards from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins and event activities.
  • Hellstone Shards can be exchanged for hellish armor sets, including recolors of classic Tier 2 armor, and other rewards.
  • The Collector's Bounty buff increases drop rates for legacy mounts from pre-Dragonflight dungeons and raids by up to 10 times.

PvP.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event returns with new challenges and rewards.
  • Treasure Goblins will appear in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, Dornogal, and The Undermine, offering new rewards including the Inarius' Charger mount.
  • Hellstone Shards are earned from Hellcaller Chests dropped by Treasure Goblins and event activities, used to purchase hellish armor sets, including recolors of classic Tier 2 sets.
  • The Undermine features unique portal mechanics, with rare spawns and raid bosses potentially triggering portals, and Portal Storms spawning additional portals with affixes.
  • Players can customize Treasure Goblin encounters by using Elixirs on summoning portals, which add specific affixes and increase the number of goblins that can spawn.
  • The Collector's Bounty buff increases drop rates for pre-Dragonflight legacy mounts and transmog loot in legacy dungeons and raids by up to 10-25 times.

Open World.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event returns, featuring Treasure Goblins and the Collector's Bounty buff.
  • The Greedy Emissary event runs from July 1 to July 29, with Treasure Goblins appearing in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, Dornogal, and Undermine, offering rewards like the Inarius' Charger mount.
  • The Collector's Bounty buff also runs from July 1 to July 29, increasing drop rates for legacy mounts and transmog items from pre-Dragonflight dungeons and raids by up to 10-25 times.
  • Portals spawn hourly in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, and Dornogal, with additional portals and Portal Storms occurring in the Undermine, which can spawn Treasure Goblins.
  • Players can influence Treasure Goblin encounters by using Elixirs on summoning portals to add specific affixes, altering their behavior and rewards.
  • Hellstone Shards earned during the event can be exchanged for diabolical rewards, including recolors of classic Tier 2 armor sets.

General.summary:
The Greedy Emissary event returns July 1-29, featuring increased loot drops and new rewards.
  • The event includes the Collector's Bounty buff, doubling transmog drop rates and increasing legacy mount drop rates in pre-Dragonflight content.
  • Treasure Goblins will appear in Stormwind, Orgrimmar, Dornogal, and Undermine, offering new rewards like the Inarius' Charger mount.
  • Players can customize Treasure Goblin encounters with Elixirs that add various affixes.
  • Hellstone Shards earned during the event can be exchanged for recolored Tier 2 armor sets and other items.

title: Break Through the Mists of Pandaria Classic on July 21

Warrior.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Mage.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Monk.summary:
The Monk class is introduced as a new playable class with the Mists of Pandaria Classic pre-patch.
  • Monks can specialize as Windwalkers for damage, Mistweavers for healing, or Brewmasters for tanking.
  • The Monk class is available to the new Pandaren race.
  • Players can experience the Monk class and Pandaren starting experience on the Wandering Isle.
  • A Level 85 Character Boost is available for Pandaren and Monks.

Evoker.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Demon Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Delves.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Raiding.summary:
Mists of Pandaria Classic will launch Mogu'shan Vaults raid on July 31.
  • Mogu'shan Vaults is located in Kun Lai Summit.
  • The raid will feature 6 bosses.
  • Available difficulties include 10-player Normal and Heroic, and 25-player Normal and Heroic.

M+.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

PvP.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Open World.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

General.summary:
Mists of Pandaria Classic launches July 21, with pre-patch on July 1.
  • New playable race: Pandaren.
  • New class: Monk.
  • Revamped classes, AOE looting, Pet Battles, and Theramore's Fall scenario.
  • Earn a Sage Serpent mount in modern WoW by completing the Pandaren starting experience in MoP Classic.
  • Mogu'shan Vaults raid opens July 31.

title: Mists of Pandaria Classic: A Profession Primer

Warrior.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Mage.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Rogue.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Priest.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Paladin.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Warlock.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Death Knight.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Druid.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Monk.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Evoker.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Demon Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Delves.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Raiding.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

M+.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

PvP.summary:
Spirit of Harmony can be used to purchase PvP and starter dungeon gear recipes.
  • Blacksmiths can purchase PvP and tanking armor recipes for one Spirit of Harmony each.
  • Leatherworkers can purchase PvP armor recipes for one Spirit of Harmony each.
  • Tailors can purchase PvP armor recipes for one Spirit of Harmony each.

Open World.summary:
Spirit of Harmony is a new bind-on-pickup crafting material found on all lootable creatures in Pandaria.
  • Spirit of Harmony can be used to purchase various profession-specific bonuses and materials from a vendor in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms.
  • Blacksmithing, Leatherworking, and Tailoring utilize Spirit of Harmony for epic item recipes, including PvP and starter dungeon gear.
  • Herbalists can find Golden Lotus, which has a chance to grant a treasure-finding buff when picked.
  • Archaeology dig sites have been expanded to six locations, with a chance for Sha to appear, dropping extra fragments and keystone.
  • Cooking introduces specialized training paths and individual stat-boosting food items, with rewards from the Ironpaw faction.

General.summary:
Spirit of Harmony is a new bind-on-pickup material central to many Mists of Pandaria professions.
  • Spirit of Harmony can be obtained from lootable creatures and used to purchase profession bonuses or materials.
  • Blacksmithing, Leatherworking, and Tailoring utilize Spirit of Harmony for epic item recipes, including PvP and starter dungeon gear.
  • New profession-specific items include Engineering mounts, Alchemy transmutes, and specialized cooking recipes.
  • Herbalism introduces new herbs like Golden Lotus, while Mining features Ghost Iron and Trillium.
  • Jewelcrafting allows for gem discovery bypasses and the creation of Panther mounts.

title: Journey Through the Wandering Isle and Take on the Way of the Monk

Warrior.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Mage.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Rogue.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Priest.summary:
Priest is available as a class choice for Pandaren characters.
  • Priests are one of the classes available for Pandaren characters to choose upon reaching level 10.

Paladin.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Warlock.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Death Knight.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Druid.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Monk.summary:
The Monk class is uniquely tied to the narrative of the Wandering Isle, representing discipline, balance, and physical mastery.
  • Monks are defined by their fluidity and adaptability, with specializations for tanking (Brewmaster), healing (Mistweaver), and damage (Windwalker).
  • Brewmaster monks utilize Stagger to delay incoming damage, reflecting resilience and cleverness.
  • Mistweaver monks blend traditional healing with melee abilities for a hybrid playstyle.
  • Windwalker monks are martial offense experts, using combos and chi for high damage.
  • The Monk class is available to Pandaren, Human, Orc, Dwarf, Tauren, Gnome, Troll, Draenei, and Blood Elf races.

Evoker.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Demon Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Delves.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Raiding.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

M+.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

PvP.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Open World.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

General.summary:
Pandaren and the Monk class are introduced in Mists of Pandaria.
  • Pandaren start on the Wandering Isle, a living turtle named Shen-zin Su.
  • Pandaren are neutral until level 10, then choose Alliance or Horde.
  • Available Pandaren classes include Warrior, Hunter, Rogue, Priest, Shaman, Mage, and Monk.
  • Monks are available to many races and specialize in Tanking (Brewmaster), Healing (Mistweaver), or Damage (Windwalker).
  • The Wandering Isle storyline involves healing Shen-zin Su and leads Pandaren to join a faction.

title: Mists of Pandaria Classic: Enter the Mogu’shan Vaults Raid July 31!

Warrior.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Mage.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Rogue.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Priest.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Paladin.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Warlock.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Death Knight.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Druid.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Monk.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Evoker.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Demon Hunter.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Delves.summary:
Mogu'shan Vaults, a raid instance, is now available.
  • The Mogu'shan Vaults is located in Kun Lai Summit and features 6 bosses.
  • Bosses include The Stone Guard, Feng the Accursed, Gara'jal the Spiritbinder, The Spirit Kings, Elegon, and Will of the Emperor.
  • The raid is available on Normal and Heroic difficulties for both 10 and 25 player modes.
  • Several achievements are available, with a title reward "Delver of the Vaults" for completing all Heroic difficulty achievements.

Raiding.summary:
Mogu’shan Vaults, a raid from the Pandaria expansion, is now available in Retail WoW.
  • The raid is located in the Kun Lai Summit and features 6 bosses.
  • It is available in Normal and Heroic difficulties for 10 and 25 players.
  • Bosses include The Stone Guard, Feng the Accursed, Gara’jal the Spiritbinder, The Spirit Kings, Elegon, and Will of the Emperor.
  • Several raid achievements are available, including difficulty-specific achievements and unique challenge achievements for each boss.
  • Completing certain achievements can reward players with titles such as "Delver of the Vaults".

M+.summary:
Mogu'shan Vaults will be available as a Mythic+ dungeon.
  • Mogu'shan Vaults will be added to the Mythic+ rotation.
  • The dungeon features six bosses: The Stone Guard, Feng the Accursed, Gara’jal the Spiritbinder, The Spirit Kings, Elegon, and Will of the Emperor.
  • Achievements are available for completing the dungeon and specific boss encounters on various difficulties.
  • Players can earn the title "Delver of the Vaults" by completing all Heroic difficulty achievements.

PvP.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Open World.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

General.summary:
Mogu'shan Vaults, a classic raid from Mists of Pandaria, is returning to Retail WoW on July 31st.
  • The raid will be available in Normal and Heroic difficulties for both 10 and 25-player groups.
  • It features six bosses, including the Stone Guard, Feng the Accursed, and Elegon.
  • Players can earn achievements, some with unique titles like "Delver of the Vaults."
  • The raid is located in the Kun Lai Summit and was originally designed for level 90 characters.

title: Hotfixes: June 24, 2025

Warrior.summary:
Warrior class changes focus on damage increases for Arms and Fury specializations.
  • Arms: Whirlwind damage increased by 100%.
  • Fury: Whirlwind damage increased by 120%.
  • Fury: Thunder Clap damage increased by 25%.
  • Fury: Odyn’s Fury damage increased by 30%.
  • Fury: Mountain Thane: Thunder Blast damage increased by 25%.
  • Arms: Colossus Smash can no longer be parried.
  • Protection: Fixed a bug causing Shield Charge to deal damage extra times or to targets near their starting position.

Mage.summary:
Mage Frost damage has been increased by 3% in non-PvP content.
  • Frost Mage damage increased by 3%.
  • Frostfire: Overpowered Barrier now causes Blazing Barrier to reflect 40% of damage absorbed (was 60%) in PvP.
  • Fire Mage Pyroblast damage increased by 20% in PvP.
  • Fire Mage Fire Blast damage increased by 15% in PvP.
  • Fire Mage Fireball damage increased by 15% in PvP.

Rogue.summary:
Subtlety Rogues received a 5% all damage increase.
  • Subtlety Rogues: All damage increased by 5%. Does not affect PvP combat.
  • Outlaw Rogues: Combat Stamina now increases Stamina by 18% in PvP combat (was 12%).
  • Trickster Rogues: Fixed an issue that prevented Blade Flurry and Nimble Flurry from dealing increased damage to targets with the Fazed debuff applied.
  • Assassination Rogues: Kingsbane can no longer be parried.
  • Outlaw Rogues: Fixed an issue that could cause Blade Flurry to strike below the maximum number of available targets when fighting near dead enemies.
  • Outlaw Rogues: Fixed an issue that caused Blade Flurry to deal an incorrect amount of damage with the Deft Maneuvers talent selected.
  • Outlaw Rogues: Fixed an issue that prevented Roll the Bones' Grand Melee buff from updating Blade Flurry's damage output dynamically when gaining or losing the buff.
  • Subtlety Rogues: Fixed an issue that could cause Nimble Flurry to strike below the maximum number of available targets when fighting near dead enemies.

Priest.summary:
Priest class changes focus on Shadow and Discipline specializations.
  • Shadow Priests see an increase to Psychic Link damage, Halo damage, and Voidweaver's Entropic Rift damage.
  • Discipline Priests have Power Word: Radiance healing no longer reduced in PvP combat, and Ultimate Penitence damage and healing increased in PvP combat.
  • Discipline Priests also had an issue resolved where the Cooldown Manager tracked Power Word: Shield duration instead of its cooldown.
  • Holy Priests had an issue fixed where Prayer of Healing could be displayed on the Cooldown Manager when not talented.

Paladin.summary:
Several Paladin class changes and fixes have been implemented.
  • An issue causing Divine Hammer and Shield of the Righteous to not cast Empyrean Hammer has been resolved.
  • Holy Paladin's Lightsmith: Blessing of the Forge healing increased by 15%.
  • Holy Paladin's Lightsmith: Hammer and Anvil healing increased by 20%.
  • An issue causing Avenging Wrath to not function properly when talented into Radiant Glory has been resolved for Retribution Paladins.
  • The Avenging Shield buff granted from the Scarlet Enclave 6-piece set bonus for Protection Paladins now correctly lasts the same duration as Avenging Wrath.

Hunter.summary:
Hunter class changes focus on Survival specialization with damage increases.
  • Survival Hunter's Explosive Shot damage increased by 15%.
  • Survival Hunter's Fury of the Eagle damage increased by 25%.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of the Eagle variants of Raptor Strike and Mongoose Bite were dealing less damage than intended.
  • Fixed an issue where casting Coordinated Assault at greater than 30 yards away could grant Howl of the Pack Leader twice.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of the Eagle was not correctly extending the range of Spirit Bond.

General.summary:
The War Within receives a series of hotfixes addressing class balance, dungeon mechanics, and quest progression.
  • Tank threat generation increased by 15% across all specializations.
  • Several class set bonuses and individual spell damages were adjusted for balance.
  • Delve item effects, including Durable Information Storage Container belt effects, were tuned.
  • Various quest and lorewalking issues were resolved, improving player experience.
  • Dungeon encounters in Darkflame Cleft and Liberation of Undermine saw bug fixes and tuning adjustments.
